bibl.title: Despatch from Albert Bushnell to William M. Evarts, Janurary 23, 1878
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
<pb facs="20170615_142950"
Cm. William M. Earnst Secretary of State, Washington, D.C.
Sir,
I have to transmit here with to the Department copies of the action, recently taken by tht Gaboon, and Corisel Mipon, and the Conisee Presb try; relating to a certain William Behored, who has threanted, I understand to complain of my action in his call, He has threatened the French Commandant in a similar manor.
So he was not an American citizens, I had no occasion to act officially in reference to him; and may acted with my associates, essentially when duty demanded such cooperating. He has left Gaboon + gone to Corices, a Spanish inbound, but still retains the hallucination that he has right to our property support.
I have the honor to be Sir Most Respectfully, Your Obedient Servant *unclear*
